Sure! Here are some suggestions for a data analysis project topic in a statistics class:

Analyze the effect of temperature on the growth rate of tomato plants. You can gather temperature data from a weather station or internet data sources, and measure the growth rate of tomato plants at different temperatures. You can use regression analysis to determine if there is a positive or negative relationship between temperature and growth rate.

Analyze the relationship between fruit consumption and heart disease. You can use data from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey to analyze the relationship between fruit consumption and various measures of heart disease, such as heart attack, stroke, and other cardiovascular diseases. You can use regression analysis to determine if there is a positive or negative relationship between fruit consumption and heart disease.
